Raag Aasaa − Part 001 347 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 347 : 2 Raag Aasaa, First Mehl, First House, So Dar ~ That Gate: 347 : 3 What is that Gate, and what is that Home, in which You sit and take care of all? 347 : 4 Countless musical instruments of so many various kinds vibrate there for You; so many are the musicians there for You. 347 : 5 There are so many Ragas there for You, along with their accompanying harmonies; so many minstrels sing to You. 347 : 6 The winds sing to You, as do water and fire; the Righteous Judge of Dharma sings at Your Door. 347 : 7 Chitar and Gupat, the recording angels of the conscious and the subconscious, sing to You; they know, and they write, and on the basis of what they write, the Lord of Dharma passes judgement. 347 : 8 Shiva and Brahma and the Goddess Parvaati, so beautiful and ever adorned by You, sing to You. 2

347 : 9 The Indras, seated upon their celestial thrones, with the deities at Your Gate, sing to You. 347 : 10 The Siddhas in Samaadhi sing to You, and the Holy Saints, in their contemplative meditation, sing to You. 347 : 11 The celibates, the truthful and the patient beings sing to You, and the mighty warriors sing to You. 347 : 12 The scholarly Pandits sing to You, along with the holy Rishis and the readers of the Vedas throughout the ages. 347 : 13 The Mohinis, the heavenly beauties who entice the heart in paradise, in this world and in the nether regions, sing to You. 347 : 14 The fourteen priceless jewels created by You, and the sixty−eight holy places of pilgrimage, sing to You. 347 : 15 The mighty warriors and the divine heroes sing to You, and the four sources of creation sing to You. 347 : 16 The continents, the worlds and the solar systems, created and installed by Your Hand, sing to You. 347 : 17 Raag Aasaa − Part 001 3

They alone sing to You, who are pleasing to Your Will, and who are imbued with the nectar of Your devotional worship. 347 : 18 So many others sing to You, they do not come into my mind; how can Nanak think of them? 347 : 19 That Lord and Master − He is True, forever True; He is True, and True is His Name. 347 : 20 He who created the creation is True, and He shall always be True; He shall not depart, even when the creation departs. 347 : 21 He created the world of Maya with its various colors and species. 347 : 22 Having created the creation, He Himself watches over it, as it pleases His Greatness. 347 : 23 Whatever pleases Him, that is what He does. No one can issue any commands to Him. −− Raag Aasaa − Part 001 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 001 4

Raag Aasaa − Part 002 348 : 24 He is the King, the King of Kings, the Emperor of Kings! Nanak lives in surrender to His Will. ||1||1|| 348 : 25 Aasaa, Fourth Mehl: 348 : 26 That Lord is Immaculate; the Lord God is Immaculate. The Lord is Unapproachable, Unfathomable and Incomparable. 348 : 27 All meditate, all meditate on You, O Dear Lord, O True Creator. 348 : 28 All beings are Yours; You are the Giver of all beings. 348 : 29 So meditate on the Lord, O Saints; He is the One who takes away all pain. 348 : 30 The Lord Himself is the Master, and He Himself is His own servant. O Nanak, how insignificant are mortal beings! ||1|| 348 : 31 You are totally pervading within each and every heart; O Lord, You are the One Primal Being, All−permeating. 348 : 32 5

Some are givers, and some are beggars; all of this is Your wondrous play! 348 : 33 You Yourself are the Giver, and You Yourself are the Enjoyer. I know of no other than You. 348 : 34 You are the Supreme Lord God, Infinite and Eternal; what Glorious Praises of Yours should I speak and chant? 348 : 35 Unto those who serve, unto those who serve You, slave Nanak is a sacrifice. ||2|| 348 : 36 Those who meditate on the Lord, those who meditate on You, O Dear Lord, those humble beings dwell in peace in this world. 348 : 37 They are liberated, they are liberated, who meditate on the Lord; the noose of Death is cut away from them. 348 : 38 Those who meditate on the Fearless One, on the Fearless Lord, all their fears are dispelled. 348 : 39 Those who have served, those who have served my Dear Lord, are absorbed into the Being of the Lord, Har, Har. 348 : 40 Blessed are they, blessed are they, who have meditated on the Dear Lord; slave Nanak is a sacrifice to them. ||3|| 348 : 41 Raag Aasaa − Part 002 6

Devotion to You, devotion to You, is a treasure, overflowing, infinite and endless. 348 : 42 Your devotees, Your devotees praise You, O Dear Lord, in many and various ways. 348 : 43 For You, so many, for You, so very many, O Dear Lord, perform worship and adoration; they practice penance and endlessly chant in meditation. 348 : 44 For You, many − for You, so very many read the various Simritees and Shaastras; they perform religious rituals and the six ceremonies. 348 : 45 Those devotees, those devotees are good, O servant Nanak, who are pleasing to my Lord God. ||4|| 348 : 46 You are the Primal Being, the Unrivalled Creator Lord; there is no other as Great as You. 348 : 47 You are the One, age after age; forever and ever, You are One and the same. You are the Eternal, Unchanging Creator. 348 : 48 Whatever pleases You comes to pass. Whatever You Yourself do, happens. 348 : 49 You Yourself created the entire Universe, and having done so, You Yourself shall destroy it all. 348 : 50 Raag Aasaa − Part 002 7

Servant Nanak sings the Glorious Praises of the Creator, the Knower of all. ||5||2|| 348 : 51 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 348 : 52 Raag Aasaa, First Mehl, Chaupaday, Second House: 348 : 53 Hearing, everyone calls You Great, 348 : 54 but only one who has seen You, knows just how Great You are. −− Raag Aasaa − Part 002 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 002 8

Raag Aasaa − Part 003 349 : 55 No one can measure Your Worth, or describe You. 349 : 56 Those who describe You, remain absorbed in You. ||1|| 349 : 57 O my Great Lord and Master of Unfathomable Depth, You are the Ocean of Excellence. 349 : 58 No one knows the greatness of Your expanse. ||1||Pause|| 349 : 59 All the contemplators met together and practiced contemplation; 349 : 60 all the appraisers met together and tried to appraise You. 349 : 61 The theologians, the meditators and the teachers of teachers 349 : 62 could not express even an iota of Your Greatness. ||2|| 349 : 63 All Truth, all austerities, all goodness, 9

349 : 64 and the greatness of the Siddhas, the beings of perfect spiritual powers 349 : 65 − without You, none has attained such spiritual powers. 349 : 66 They are obtained by Your Grace; their flow cannot be blocked. ||3|| 349 : 67 What can the helpless speaker do? 349 : 68 Your bounties are overflowing with Your Praises. 349 : 69 And the one, unto whom You give − why should he think of any other? 349 : 70 O Nanak, the True Lord is the Embellisher. ||4||1|| 349 : 71 Aasaa, First Mehl: 349 : 72 Chanting the Name, I live; forgetting it, I die. 349 : 73 It is so difficult to chant the True Name. Raag Aasaa − Part 003 10

349 : 74 If someone feels hunger for the True Name, 349 : 75 then that hunger shall consume his pains. ||1|| 349 : 76 So how could I ever forget Him, O my Mother? 349 : 77 True is the Master, and True is His Name. ||1||Pause|| 349 : 78 People have grown weary of trying to appraise the greatness of the True Name, but they have not been able to appraise even an iota of it. 349 : 79 Even if they were all to meet together and recount them, 349 : 80 You would not be made any greater or lesser. ||2|| 349 : 81 He does not die − there is no reason to mourn. 349 : 82 He continues to give, but His Provisions are never exhausted. 349 : 83 This Glorious Virtue is His alone − no one else is like Him; Raag Aasaa − Part 003 11

349 : 84 there has never been anyone like Him, and there never shall be. ||3|| 349 : 85 As Great as You Yourself are, so Great are Your Gifts. 349 : 86 It is You who created day and night as well. 349 : 87 Those who forget their Lord and Master are vile and despicable. 349 : 88 O Nanak, without the Name, people are wretched outcasts. ||4||2|| 349 : 89 Aasaa, First Mehl: 349 : 90 If a beggar cries out at the door, the Master hears it in His Mansion. 349 : 91 Whether He receives him or pushes him away, it is the Gift of the Lord's Greatness. ||1|| 349 : 92 Recognize the Lord's Light within all, and do not consider social class or status; there are no classes or castes in the world hereafter. ||1||Pause|| 349 : 93 He Himself acts, and He Himself inspires us to act. Raag Aasaa − Part 003 12

349 : 94 He Himself considers our complaints. 349 : 95 Since You, O Creator Lord, are the Doer, 349 : 96 why should I submit to the world? ||2|| 349 : 97 You Yourself created and You Yourself give. 349 : 98 You Yourself eliminate evil−mindedness; 349 : 99 by Guru's Grace, You come to abide in our minds, 349 : 100 and then, pain and darkness are dispelled from within. ||3|| 349 : 101 He Himself infuses love for the Truth. 349 : 102 Unto others, the Truth is not bestowed. 349 : 103 If He bestows it upon someone, says Nanak, then, in the world hereafter, that person is not called to account. ||4||3|| Raag Aasaa − Part 003 13

349 : 104 Aasaa, First Mehl: 349 : 105 The urges of the heart are like cymbals and ankle−bells; 349 : 106 the drum of the world resounds with the beat. 349 : 107 Naarad dances to the tune of the Dark Age of Kali Yuga; 349 : 108 where can the celibates and the men of truth place their feet? ||1|| 349 : 109 Nanak is a sacrifice to the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 349 : 110 The world is blind; our Lord and Master is All−seeing. ||1||Pause|| 349 : 111 The disciple feeds on the Guru; 349 : 112 out of love for bread, he comes to dwell in his home. −− Raag Aasaa − Part 003 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 003 14

Raag Aasaa − Part 004 350 : 113 If one were to live and eat for hundreds of years, 350 : 114 that day alone would be auspicious, when he recognizes his Lord and Master. ||2|| 350 : 115 Beholding the sight of the petitioner, compassion is not aroused. 350 : 116 No one lives without give and take. 350 : 117 The king administers justice only if his palm is greased. 350 : 118 No one is moved by the Name of God. ||3|| 350 : 119 O Nanak, they are human beings in form and name only; 350 : 120 by their deeds they are dogs − this is the Command of the Lord's Court. 350 : 121 By Guru's Grace, if one sees himself as a guest in this world, 15

350 : 122 then he gains honor in the Court of the Lord. ||4||4|| 350 : 123 Aasaa, First Mehl: 350 : 124 As much as the Shabad is in the mind, so much is Your melody; as much as the form of the universe is, so much is Your body, Lord. 350 : 125 You Yourself are the tongue, and You Yourself are the nose. Do not speak of any other, O my mother. ||1|| 350 : 126 My Lord and Master is One; 350 : 127 He is the One and Only; O Siblings of Destiny, He is the One alone. ||1||Pause|| 350 : 128 He Himself kills, and He Himself emancipates; He Himself gives and takes. 350 : 129 He Himself beholds, and He Himself rejoices; He Himself bestows His Glance of Grace. ||2|| 350 : 130 Whatever He is to do, that is what He is doing. No one else can do anything. 350 : 131 Raag Aasaa − Part 004 16

As He projects Himself, so do we describe Him; this is all Your Glorious Greatness, Lord. ||3|| 350 : 132 The Dark Age of Kali Yuga is the bottle of wine; Maya is the sweet wine, and the intoxicated mind continues to drink it in. 350 : 133 He Himself assumes all sorts of forms; thus poor Nanak speaks. ||4||5|| 350 : 134 Aasaa, First Mehl: 350 : 135 Make your intellect your instrument, and love your tambourine; 350 : 136 thus bliss and lasting pleasure shall be produced in your mind. 350 : 137 This is devotional worship, and this is the practice of penance. 350 : 138 So dance in this love, and keep the beat with your feet. ||1|| 350 : 139 Know that the perfect beat is the Praise of the Lord; 350 : 140 other dances produce only temporary pleasure in the mind. ||1||Pause|| Raag Aasaa − Part 004 17

350 : 141 Play the two cymbals of truth and contentment. 350 : 142 Let your ankle bells be the lasting Vision of the Lord. 350 : 143 Let your harmony and music be the elimination of duality. 350 : 144 So dance in this love, and keep the beat with your feet. ||2|| 350 : 145 Let the fear of God within your heart and mind be your spinning dance, 350 : 146 and keep up, whether sitting or standing. 350 : 147 To roll around in the dust is to know that the body is only ashes. 350 : 148 So dance in this love, and keep the beat with your feet. ||3|| 350 : 149 Keep the company of the disciples, the students who love the teachings. 350 : 150 As Gurmukh, listen to the True Name. Raag Aasaa − Part 004 18

350 : 151 O Nanak, chant it, over and over again. 350 : 152 So dance in this love, and keep the beat with your feet. ||4||6|| 350 : 153 Aasaa, First Mehl: 350 : 154 He created the air, and He supports the whole world; he bound water and fire together. 350 : 155 The blind, ten−headed Raavan had his heads cut off, but what greatness was obtained by killing him? ||1|| 350 : 156 What Glories of Yours can be chanted? 350 : 157 You are totally pervading everywhere; You love and cherish all. ||1||Pause|| 350 : 158 You created all beings, and You hold the world in Your Hands; what greatness is it to put a ring in the nose of the black cobra, as Krishna did? 350 : 159 Whose Husband are You? Who is Your wife? You are subtly diffused and pervading in all. ||2|| 350 : 160 Raag Aasaa − Part 004 19

Brahma, the bestower of blessings, entered the stem of the lotus, with his relatives, to find the extent of the universe. 350 : 161 Proceeding on, he could not find its limits; what glory was obtained by killing Kansa, the king? ||3|| 350 : 162 The jewels were produced and brought forth by churning the ocean of milk. The other gods proclaimed "We are the ones who did this!" −− Raag Aasaa − Part 004 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 004 20

Raag Aasaa − Part 005 351 : 163 Says Nanak, by hiding, how can the Lord be hidden? He has given each their share, one by one. ||4||7|| 351 : 164 Aasaa, First Mehl: 351 : 165 The vine of good actions and character has spread out, and it bears the fruit of the Lord's Name. 351 : 166 The Name has no form or outline; it vibrates with the unstruck Sound Current; through the Word of the Shabad, the Immaculate Lord is revealed. ||1|| 351 : 167 One can speak on this only when he knows it. 351 : 168 He alone drinks in the Ambrosial Nectar. ||1||Pause|| 351 : 169 Those who drink it in are enraptured; their bonds and shackles are cut away. 351 : 170 When one's light blends into the Divine Light, then the desire for Maya is ended. ||2|| 351 : 171 21

Among all lights, I behold Your Form; all the worlds are Your Maya. 351 : 172 Among the tumults and forms, He sits in serene detachment; He bestows His Glance of Grace upon those who are engrossed in the illusion. ||3|| 351 : 173 The Yogi who plays on the instrument of the Shabad gains the Blessed Vision of the Infinitely Beautiful Lord. 351 : 174 He, the Lord, is immersed in the Unstruck Shabad of the Word, says Nanak, the humble and meek. ||4||8|| 351 : 175 Aasaa, First Mehl: 351 : 176 My virtue is that I carry the load of my words upon my head. 351 : 177 The real words are the Words of the Creator Lord. 351 : 178 How useless are eating, drinking and laughing, 351 : 179 if the Lord is not cherished in the heart! ||1|| 351 : 180 Why should someone care for anything else, Raag Aasaa − Part 005 22

351 : 181 if throughout his life, he gathers in that which is truly worth gathering? ||1||Pause|| 351 : 182 The intellect of the mind is like a drunken elephant. 351 : 183 Whatever one utters is totally false, the most false of the false. 351 : 184 So what face should we put on to offer our prayer, 351 : 185 when both virtue and vice are close at hand as witnesses? ||2|| 351 : 186 As You make us, so we become. 351 : 187 Without You, there is no other at all. 351 : 188 As is the understanding which You bestow, so do we receive. 351 : 189 As it pleases Your Will, so do You lead us. ||3|| 351 : 190 The divine crystalline harmonies, their consorts, and their celestial families Raag Aasaa − Part 005 23

351 : 191 − from them, the essence of Ambrosial Nectar is produced. 351 : 192 O Nanak, this is the wealth and property of the Creator Lord. 351 : 193 If only this essential reality were understood! ||4||9|| 351 : 194 Aasaa, First Mehl: 351 : 195 When by His Grace He came to my home, then my companions met together to celebrate my marriage. 351 : 196 Beholding this play, my mind became blissful; my Husband Lord has come to marry me. ||1|| 351 : 197 So sing − yes, sing the songs of wisdom and reflection, O brides. 351 : 198 My spouse, the Life of the world, has come into my home. ||1||Pause|| 351 : 199 When I was married within the Gurdwara, the Guru's Gate, I met my Husband Lord, and I came to know Him. 351 : 200 Raag Aasaa − Part 005 24

The Word of His Shabad is pervading the three worlds; when my ego was quieted, my mind became happy. ||2|| 351 : 201 He Himself arranges His own affairs; His affairs cannot be arranged by anyone else. 351 : 202 By the affair of this marriage, truth, contentment, mercy and faith are produced; but how rare is that Gurmukh who understands it! ||3|| 351 : 203 Says Nanak, that Lord alone is the Husband of all. 351 : 204 She, upon whom He casts His Glance of Grace, becomes the happy soul−bride. ||4||10|| 351 : 205 Aasaa, First Mehl: 351 : 206 Home and forest are the same, for one who dwells in the balance of intuitive peace and poise. 351 : 207 His evil−mindedness departs, and the Praises of God take its place. 351 : 208 To chant the True Name with one's mouth is the true ladder. −− Raag Aasaa − Part 005 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 005 25

Raag Aasaa − Part 006 352 : 209 Serving the True Guru, one finds one's own place within the self. ||1|| 352 : 210 To conquer the mind is the knowledge of the six Shaastras. 352 : 211 The Divine Light of the Lord God is perfectly pervading. ||1||Pause|| 352 : 212 Excessive thirst for Maya makes people wear all sorts of religious robes. 352 : 213 The pain of corruption destroys the body's peace. 352 : 214 Sexual desire and anger steal the wealth of the self within. 352 : 215 But by abandoning duality, one is emancipated through the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||2|| 352 : 216 In the Lord's Praise and adoration is intuitive peace, poise and bliss. 352 : 217 The Love of the Lord God is one's family and friends. 26

352 : 218 He Himself is the Doer, and He Himself is the Forgiver. 352 : 219 My body and mind belong to the Lord; my life is at His Command. ||3|| 352 : 220 Falsehood and corruption cause terrible suffering. 352 : 221 All the religious robes and social classes look just like dust. 352 : 222 Whoever is born, continues to come and go. 352 : 223 O Nanak, only the Naam and the Lord's Command are eternal and everlasting. ||4||11|| 352 : 224 Aasaa, First Mehl: 352 : 225 In the pool is the one incomparably beautiful lotus. 352 : 226 It blossoms continually; its form is pure and fragrant. 352 : 227 The swans pick up the bright jewels. Raag Aasaa − Part 006 27

352 : 228 They take on the essence of the All−powerful Lord of the Universe. ||1|| 352 : 229 Whoever is seen, is subject to birth and death. 352 : 230 In the pool without water, the lotus is not seen. ||1||Pause|| 352 : 231 How rare are those who know and understand this secret. 352 : 232 The Vedas continually speak of the three branches. 352 : 233 One who merges into the knowledge of the Lord as absolute and related, 352 : 234 serves the True Guru and obtains the supreme status. ||2|| 352 : 235 One who is imbued with the Love of the Lord and dwells continually upon Him is liberated. 352 : 236 He is the king of kings, and blossoms forth continually. 352 : 237 That one whom You preserve, by bestowing Your Mercy, O Lord, Raag Aasaa − Part 006 28

352 : 238 even the sinking stone − You float that one across. ||3|| 352 : 239 Your Light is pervading the three worlds; I know that You are permeating the three worlds. 352 : 240 When my mind turned away from Maya, I came to dwell in my own home. 352 : 241 Nanak falls at the feet of that person who immerses himself in the Lord's Love, and performs devotional worship night and day. ||4||12|| 352 : 242 Aasaa, First Mehl: 352 : 243 Receiving the True Teachings from the Guru, arguments depart. 352 : 244 But through excessive cleverness, one is only plastered with dirt. 352 : 245 The filth of attachment is removed by the True Name of the Lord. 352 : 246 By Guru's Grace, one remains lovingly attached to the Lord. ||1|| 352 : 247 He is the Presence Ever−present; offer your prayers to Him. Raag Aasaa − Part 006 29

352 : 248 Pain and pleasure are in the Hands of God, the True Creator. ||1||Pause|| 352 : 249 One who practices falsehood comes and goes. 352 : 250 By speaking and talking, His limits cannot be found. 352 : 251 Whatever one sees, is not understood. 352 : 252 Without the Name, satisfaction does not enter into the mind. ||2|| 352 : 253 Whoever is born is afflicted by disease, 352 : 254 tortured by the pain of egotism and Maya. 352 : 255 They alone are saved, who are protected by God. 352 : 256 Serving the True Guru, they drink in the Amrit, the Ambrosial Nectar. ||3|| 352 : 257 The unstable mind is restrained by tasting this Nectar. Raag Aasaa − Part 006 30

352 : 258 Serving the True Guru, one comes to cherish the Ambrosial Nectar of the Shabad. 352 : 259 Through the True Word of the Shabad, the state of liberation is obtained. 352 : 260 O Nanak, self−conceit is eradicated from within. ||4||13|| 352 : 261 Aasaa, First Mehl: 352 : 262 Whatever He has done, has proved to be true. 352 : 263 The True Guru bestows the Ambrosial Naam, the Name of the Lord. 352 : 264 With the Naam in the heart, the mind is not separated from the Lord. 352 : 265 Night and day, one dwells with the Beloved. ||1|| 352 : 266 O Lord, please keep me in the Protection of Your Sanctuary. −− Raag Aasaa − Part 006 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 006 31

Raag Aasaa − Part 007 353 : 267 By Guru's Grace, I have obtained the sublime essence of the Lord; I have received the wealth of the Naam and the nine treasures. ||1||Pause|| 353 : 268 Those whose karma and Dharma − whose actions and faith − are in the True Name of the True Lord 353 : 269 − I am forever a sacrifice to them. 353 : 270 Those who are imbued with the Lord are accepted and respected. 353 : 271 In their company, the supreme wealth is obtained. ||2|| 353 : 272 Blessed is that bride, who has obtained the Lord as her Husband. 353 : 273 She is imbued with the Lord, and she reflects upon the Word of His Shabad. 353 : 274 She saves herself, and saves her family and friends as well. 353 : 275 She serves the True Guru, and contemplates the essence of reality. ||3|| 32

353 : 276 The True Name is my social status and honor. 353 : 277 The love of the Truth is my karma and Dharma − my faith and my actions, and my self−control. 353 : 278 O Nanak, one who is forgiven by the Lord is not called to account. 353 : 279 The One Lord erases duality. ||4||14|| 353 : 280 Aasaa, First Mehl: 353 : 281 Some come, and after they come, they go. 353 : 282 Some are imbued with the Lord; they remain absorbed in Him. 353 : 283 Some find no place of rest at all, on the earth or in the sky. 353 : 284 Those who do not meditate on the Name of the Lord are the most unfortunate. ||1|| 353 : 285 From the Perfect Guru, the way to salvation is obtained. Raag Aasaa − Part 007 33

353 : 286 This world is a terrifying ocean of poison; through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the Lord helps us cross over. ||1||Pause|| 353 : 287 Those, whom God unites with Himself, 353 : 288 cannot be crushed by death. 353 : 289 The beloved Gurmukhs remain immaculately pure, 353 : 290 like the lotus in the water, which remains untouched. ||2|| 353 : 291 Tell me: who should we call good or bad? 353 : 292 Behold the Lord God; the truth is revealed to the Gurmukh. 353 : 293 I speak the Unspoken Speech of the Lord, contemplating the Guru's Teachings. 353 : 294 I join the Sangat, the Guru's Congregation, and I find God's limits. ||3|| 353 : 295 The Shaastras, the Vedas, the Simritees and all their many secrets; Raag Aasaa − Part 007 34

353 : 296 bathing at the sixty−eight holy places of pilgrimage − all this is found by enshrining the sublime essence of the Lord in the heart. 353 : 297 The Gurmukhs are immaculately pure; no filth sticks to them. 353 : 298 O Nanak, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, abides in the heart, by the greatest pre−ordained destiny. ||4||15|| 353 : 299 Aasaa, First Mehl: 353 : 300 Bowing down, again and again, I fall at the Feet of my Guru; through Him, I have seen the Lord, the Divine Self, within. 353 : 301 Through contemplation and meditation, the Lord dwells within the heart; see this, and understand. ||1|| 353 : 302 So speak the Lord's Name, which shall emancipate you. 353 : 303 By Guru's Grace, the jewel of the Lord is found; ignorance is dispelled, and the Divine Light shines forth. ||1||Pause|| 353 : 304 By merely saying it with the tongue, one's bonds are not broken, and egotism and doubt do not depart from within. Raag Aasaa − Part 007 35

353 : 305 But when one meets the True Guru, egotism departs, and then, one realizes his destiny. ||2|| 353 : 306 The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is sweet and dear to His devotees; it is the ocean of peace − enshrine it within the heart. 353 : 307 The Lover of His devotees, the Life of the World, the Lord bestows the Guru's Teachings upon the intellect, and one is emancipated. ||3|| 353 : 308 One who dies fighting against his own stubborn mind finds God, and the desires of the mind are quieted. 353 : 309 O Nanak, if the Life of the World bestows His Mercy, one is intuitively attuned to the Love of the Lord. ||4||16|| 353 : 310 Aasaa, First Mehl: 353 : 311 Unto whom do they speak? Unto whom do they preach? Who understands? Let them understand themselves. 353 : 312 Who do they teach? Through study, they come to realize the Lord's Glorious Virtues. Through the Shabad, the Word of the True Guru, they come to dwell in contentment. ||1|| −− Raag Aasaa − Part 007 −− Raag Aasaa − Part 007 36

Raag Aasaa − Part 008 354 : 313 Through the Guru's Teachings, realize that He is pervading in all bodies; 354 : 314 O my soul, vibrate on the Profound, Unfathomable Lord. ||1||Pause|| 354 : 315 Loving devotion to the Lord brings endless waves of joy and delight. 354 : 316 One who dwells with the Glorious Praises of the Lord, night and day, is sanctified. 354 : 317 The birth into the world of the faithless cynic is totally useless. 354 : 318 The humble devotee of the Lord remains unattached. ||2|| 354 : 319 The body which sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord is sanctified. 354 : 320 The soul remains conscious of the Lord, absorbed in His Love. 354 : 321 The Lord is the Infinite Primal Being, beyond the beyond, the priceless jewel. 37

354 : 322 My mind is totally content, imbued with my Beloved. ||3|| 354 : 323 Those who speak and babble on and on, are truly dead. 354 : 324 God is not far away − O God, You are right here. 354 : 325 I have seen that the whole world is engrossed in Maya. 354 : 326 O Nanak, through the Guru's Teachings, I meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||4||17|| 354 : 327 Aasaa, First Mehl, Ti−Tukas: 354 : 328 One is a beggar, living on charity; 354 : 329 another is a king, absorbed in himself. 354 : 330 One receives honor, and another dishonor. 354 : 331 The Lord destroys and creates; He is enshrined in His meditation. Raag Aasaa − Part 008 38

354 : 332 There is no other as great as You. 354 : 333 So whom should I present to You? Who is good enough? ||1|| 354 : 334 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is my only Support. 354 : 335 You are the Great Giver, the Doer, the Creator. ||1||Pause|| 354 : 336 I have not walked on Your Path; I have followed the crooked path. 354 : 337 In the Court of the Lord, I find no place to sit. 354 : 338 I am mentally blind, in the bondage of Maya. 354 : 339 The wall of my body is breaking down, wearing away, growing weaker. 354 : 340 You have such high hopes of eating and living 354 : 341 − your breaths and morsels of food are already counted! ||2|| Raag Aasaa − Part 008 39

354 : 342 Night and day they are blind − please, bless them with Your Light. 354 : 343 They are drowning in the terrifying world−ocean, crying out in pain. 354 : 344 I am a sacrifice to those who chant, hear and believe in the Name. 354 : 345 Nanak utters this one prayer; 354 : 346 soul and body, all belong to You, Lord. ||3|| 354 : 347 When You bless me, I chant Your Name. 354 : 348 Thus I find my seat in the Court of the Lord. 354 : 349 When it pleases You, evil−mindedness departs, 354 : 350 and the jewel of spiritual wisdom comes to dwell in the mind. 354 : 351 When the Lord bestows His Glance of Grace, then one comes to meet the True Guru. Raag Aasaa − Part 008 40

354 : 352 Prays Nanak, carry us across the terrifying world−ocean. ||4||18|| 354 : 353 Aasaa, First Mehl, Panch−Padas: 354 : 354 A cow without milk; a bird without wings; a garden without water − totally useless! 354 : 355 What is an emperor, without respect? The chamber of the soul is so dark, without the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 354 : 356 How could I ever forget You?
